citations.narrative:
Certain medical records were not maintained for dogs sold and held by the licensee. During the inspection, the licensee
stated that she performs the following according to the written program of Veterinary Care: 1) monthly preventive care
checks to ensure properly trimmed nails, 2) monthly administration of a heartworm preventative 3) docking of tails and
removal of dewclaws on puppies at 3-5 days of age. However, at the time of the inspection medical records of these
activities were not available. Medical records are essential for APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of medical care
provided by the facility and ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, and illness.
The licensee must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These
records must include routine husbandry procedures (such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, and
treatments) performed an all animals.
To be corrected by the close of business on 1/17/2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
Certain medical records were not maintained for dogs sold and held by the licensee. During the inspection, the licensee 
stated that she performs the following according to the written program of Veterinary Care: 1) monthly preventive care 
checks to ensure properly trimmed nails, 2) monthly administration of a heartworm preventative 3) docking of tails and 
removal of dewclaws on puppies at 3-5 days of age. However, at the time of the inspection medical records of these 
activities were not available. Medical records are essential for APHIS inspectors to evaluate the quality of medical care 
provided by the facility and ensure the animals are protected from disease, injury, and illness. 
 
The licensee must keep copies of medical records for dogs and make the records available for APHIS inspection. These 
records must include routine husbandry procedures (such as vaccinations, preventive medical procedures, and 
treatments) performed an all animals. 
 
To be corrected by the close of business on 1/17/2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
